decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, while disrupting their hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Slaughter Pact, as well as generating value with cards like Lingering Souls and Scavenging Ooze. The deck also has a land destruction sub-theme with cards like Tectonic Edge. The overall strategy is to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory through aggressive attacks and control elements.

The deck focuses on using Birthing Pod to tutor for specific creatures at different mana costs, allowing for a versatile toolbox of creatures to be used in various combos or to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck includes a mix of utility creatures, combo pieces, and protection spells to help both set up powerful plays and control the board. Through the use of Birthing Pod and other creature tutoring effects, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a diverse array of threats while maintaining flexibility and adaptability in different matchups.

This deck focuses on using Birthing Pod to tutor for and play various creatures to control the board and create powerful combos. The deck utilizes a toolbox approach, with a variety of creatures that can be searched for and played as needed to respond to different situations. The goal is to assemble combinations of creatures that can generate value, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and ultimately win the game through synergistic interactions. The deck also includes disruption and mana acceleration to support its combo strategy.

The main concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 Control - UrzaTron deck is to assemble the Urza lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows for casting powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Sundering Titan, and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck also includes a range of control elements such as removal spells (Pyroclasm, Oblivion Stone), card filtering (Ancient Stirrings), and disruption (Ghost Quarter, Relic of Progenitus) to interact with the opponent's game plan and ensure its own success.

The deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures with enter-the-battlefield abilities that synergize with Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling to create powerful combos and generate advantage. It aims to control the board while constantly searching for key pieces through tutoring effects. The toolbox approach allows for flexibility in adapting to different matchups and situations, while also providing a win condition through a combo involving Spike Feeder and Archangel of Thune. The deck utilizes a mix of disruptive elements, value creatures, and combo pieces to outmaneuver opponents and secure victory.

This deck relies on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate large amounts of mana quickly. By using cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying to fetch the Tron lands, the deck aims to control the game through powerful spells like Oblivion Stone and Karn Liberated. The deck also includes various threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to close out the game. The use of Chromatic artifacts and other color-fixing lands allow for flexibility in casting spells of different colors.

This deck focuses on using the Splinter Twin combo of Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite paired with Splinter Twin to create an infinite loop of hasty creatures. The deck includes versatile spells like Remand, Lightning Bolt, and Cryptic Command to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plans. The inclusion of Tarmogoyf and Snapcaster Mage provides additional threats and card advantage. The deck aims to assemble the combo pieces quickly while maintaining control over the game until it can secure the win.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combination of Twin enchantment with Exarch and Pestermite creatures to create infinite creature tokens with haste, securing a win through fast, efficient beatdowns. The deck includes control elements like counterspells and removal to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies. Vedalken Shackles provides additional control against opposing creatures, while card draw and card selection help to find the combo pieces quickly. Overall, the deck aims to assemble the combo as quickly as possible to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through various spells such as Remand, Cryptic Command, Electrolyze, and Repeal, while ramping up mana using Search for Tomorrow and Sakura-Tribe Elder. The ultimate goal is to ramp up to seven lands, play Scapeshift, sacrificing lands to fetch Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and mountains, and deal lethal damage to the opponent. Snapcaster Mage, Serum Visions, and Telling Time provide card advantage and selection to help set up the combo. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent until it can execute its win condition.

The primary strategy of this deck is to assemble the Splinter Twin combo using either Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to create infinite token copies of the creature equipped with Splinter Twin, allowing for a quick win. The deck also includes control elements such as Remand, Cryptic Command, and Lightning Bolt to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain board control. Tarmogoyf and Snapcaster Mage provide additional threats and card advantage, while Huntmaster of the Fells can provide value and stabilization in longer games. The mana base is designed to support a smooth mana curve and ensure consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on using control spells to disrupt the opponent's strategy and stall until it can assemble the combo of Scapeshift and Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle to deal lethal damage in one turn. It also includes card draw and ramp spells to help find the combo pieces quickly. The key strategy is to survive long enough to reach the late game where it can win with a single well-timed Scapeshift. The deck also includes some removal and counterspells to protect its combo or disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main focus of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins Modern 1 vs 1 deck is to deal consistent damage to the opponent quickly and efficiently. With a low mana curve and a wide range of direct damage spells like Lava Spike, Lightning Bolt, and Searing Blaze, the deck aims to pressure the opponent early and prevent them from stabilizing. The inclusion of creatures like Goblin Guide and Hellspark Elemental adds additional aggression to the strategy, while cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Skullcrack help to disrupt the opponent's game plan and close out the game before they can recover.

This deck focuses on quickly enchanting your creatures with powerful auras to make them hard to deal with while also drawing cards and gaining life. By ensuring your creatures have hexproof and pumping them up with auras, you can overwhelm your opponent with threats that are difficult to remove. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game to secure a victory. With a strong focus on efficient creatures and powerful enchantments, this deck is built to be aggressive and difficult to stop.

The deck focuses on utilizing faerie creatures and counter spells to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of creatures like Vendilion Clique and Delver of Secrets, along with powerful spells like Remand and Mana Leak, the deck aims to maintain tempo and prevent the opponent from establishing a board presence. The inclusion of versatile burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Burst Lightning adds additional removal and reach, while equipments like Sword of Light and Shadow and Sword of Fire and Ice provide added utility and value.

The main concept of this deck revolves around using control spells like Cryptic Command and Remand to stall the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Search for Tomorrow and Sakura-Tribe Elder, then play a Scapeshift to combo with Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle for a massive amount of damage to close out the game. The deck also utilizes card advantage from Snapcaster Mage and manipulation with cards like Serum Visions to ensure consistency in drawing key pieces.

The main concept of this aggro Red Deck Wins deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using efficient and low-cost burn spells and aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Hellspark Elemental. The deck aims to control the game through burning the opponent's creatures and face, while also utilizing cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel to punish opponents for playing spells. This deck is designed to end the game as quickly as possible by overwhelming the opponent with consistent and fast damage.
